column3: What about compile-time with 5.5 and runtime <5.5?\n

utACK 06bf523

> What about compile-time with 5.5 and runtime <5.5?

Is this even possible?

QT delegates to openssl. SSL_CTX_set_options(ctx, SSL_OP_NO_SSLv2 | SSL_OP_NO_SSLv3) and similar functions would be runtime calls. If there is a way to improve upon the (current, with minimal overhead) library calls made for >=5.5, I am not aware of it.\n

> What about compile-time with 5.5 and runtime <5.5?
> Is this even possible?

No, this is not allowed. It is possible to use a newer library than the headers in most cases, but never an older.
Closing, as I'm not convinced that this is effective (see my comment above).\n

AFAIK this doesn't work: disabling pre-TLSv1 ciphers is orthogonal to disabling the pre-TLSv1 protocols. The ciphers are tagged with the protocol version in which they were introduced, but it isn't the ciphers that are insecure but the protocol itself.\nSo from what I understand this will reduce the choices of cipher arbitrarily to recent ones, possibly causing incompatibilities, but will not prev
